questions.question_text: What is a requirement for deployment of on-premises vBond controllers through the Cisco Plug and Play Connect process?

choices.B: a DNS name that identifies vBond
choices.D: a CSV file that contains all controllers

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Go with A
> then the devices will be automatically associated with a default VBOND profile if existing in the account.

https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en_us/services/downloads/plug-play-connect.pdf

B: vBond should also be fine with IP add only.
C: Without Internet connectivity, you should also be fine with manual inputting required info into vManage.
D: Don't think you need to do this for using PnP connect.

Selected Answer: B
B: DNS name that identifies vBond
390 question - How is vBond reachability resolved by vManage?
answer: DNS

How is vBond reachability resolved by vManage?

internet connectivity.

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer

Selected Answer: C
C. Internet connectivity from vManage

The requirement for deployment of on-premises vBond controllers through the Cisco Plug and Play Connect process is Internet connectivity from vManage (Option C).

The Cisco Plug and Play Connect process is used to establish secure connectivity between the vManage Network Management system and the vBond orchestrators, which are responsible for authenticating and orchestrating the control plane connections between vSmart controllers and vEdge routers. For this process to work, the vManage system must have Internet connectivity to reach and communicate with the vBond orchestrators during the initial deployment and configuration phase.
B correct answer
I thought this site was updated when there was new questions? I keep seeing posts on here that there is alot of new questions.

Not exactly control-plane as per the ENSDWI course, but still correct due to the certificates/templates

Selected Answer: C
answer is C, forget below answer

Selected Answer: C
vmanage is not part of the control plane, only component belonging to that plane is the vSmart

You can use Cisco vManage to store certificate credentials, and to create and store configurations for all Cisco edge network components. As these components come online in the network, they request their certificates and configurations from Cisco vManage. When Cisco vManage receives these requests, it pushes the certificates and configurations to the Cisco edge network devices
Vmanage
Correct

Selected Answer: C
Example: Configure a Device as a Spoke

sdwan
 interface GigabitEthernet0/0/2
 tunnel-interface
 encapsulation ipsec
 color public-internet restrict
 tunnel-qos spoke
 exit
 bandwidth-downstream 50000
 exit

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A user has selected the options while configuring a VPN Interface Ethernet feature template. What is the required configuration parameter the user must set in this template for this feature to function?

choices.D: The "Adaptive QoS" field must be set to "on".
choices.C: The "Bandwidth Downstream" field must be configured with a value.
choices.B: The "IP MTU" field must be increased from the default value of 1500 to support the additional overhead.
choices.A: The "Shaping Rate (Kbps)" field must be configured with a value.
